content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

Let <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction 4 over x squared, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Approximate the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 12, of, f of x, d x"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> using a left Riemann sum with the subintervals <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 8, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="open bracket, 8 comma 12, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

Let <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction 4 over x squared, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Approximate the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 12, of, f of x, d x"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> using a left Riemann sum with the subintervals <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 8, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="open bracket, 8 comma 12, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b)   Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 12, of, f of x, d x"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(c)   Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to infinity, of, f of x, d x"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or explain why it does not exist.

(d)   Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 12, of, f of x, times the natural log of x, d x"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
